document.text: The connection between part-of-speech ( POS ) categories and morphological properties is well-documented in linguistics but underutilized in text processing systems .
This paper proposes a novel model for morphological segmentation that is driven by this connection .

document.evidence: Our model learns that words with common affixes are likely to be in the same syntactic category and uses learned syntactic categories to refine the segmentation boundaries of words .

document.text: Although the connection between syntactic ( POS ) categories and morphological structure is wellknown , this relation is rarely exploited to improve morphological segmentation performance .
The performance gains motivate further investigation into morpho-syntactic models for unsupervised language analysis
